Package ohos.telephony

Class ShortMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.telephony.ShortMessage

  • public class ShortMessage
extends Object
    Provides methods for obtaining Short Message Service (SMS) instances.

    Applications can obtain details about an SMS message by calling the methods of this instance.

    Since:
    1

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      Indicates the SMS type.

    • Method Detail

      • getProtocolId

        public int getProtocolId​()
        Obtains the protocol identifier used for transmitting an SMS message.
        Returns:
        Returns the protocol identifier.

      • getMessageClass

        public ShortMessage.ShortMessageClass getMessageClass​()
        Obtains the SMS type.
        Returns:
        Returns the SMS type. The values are as follows:
        • ShortMessageClass#UNKNOWN - unknown type
        • ShortMessageClass#INSTANT_MESSAGE - instant message
        • ShortMessageClass#OPTIONAL_MESSAGE - SMS message to be stored on the device or SIM card
        • ShortMessageClass#SIM_MESSAGE - SMS message to be stored in the SIM card
        • ShortMessageClass#FORWARD_MESSAGE - SMS message to be forwarded to another device

      • createMessage

        public static Optional<ShortMessage> createMessage​(byte[] pdu,
                                                   String specification)
        Creates an SMS message instance based on the protocol data unit (PDU) and the specified SMS protocol.

        After receiving the original PDU data, the system creates an SMS message instance according to the specified SMS protocol.

        Parameters:
        pdu - Indicates the original data, which is obtained from the received SMS.
        specification - Indicates the SMS protocol type. The value 3gpp indicates GSM/UMTS/LTE SMS, and the value 3gpp2 indicates CDMA/LTE SMS.
        Returns:
        Returns an SMS message instance; returns null if pdu is empty or specification is not supported.

      • getVisibleMessageBody

        public String getVisibleMessageBody​()
        Obtains the SMS message body.
        Returns:
        Returns an email message body if the SMS is from an email gateway; returns an SMS message body if the SMS is not from an email gateway; returns null if the message body is invalid.

      • getVisibleRawAddress

        public String getVisibleRawAddress​()
        Obtains the address of the sender, which is to be displayed on the UI.
        Returns:
        Returns an email address if the SMS is from an email gateway; returns an SMS address if the SMS is not from an email gateway; returns null if the original address is invalid.

      • getScAddress

        public String getScAddress​()
        Obtains the short message service center (SMSC) address.
        Returns:
        Returns the SMSC address; returns null if the address does not exist.

      • getScTimestamp

        public long getScTimestamp​()
        Obtains the SMSC timestamp.
        Returns:
        Returns the SMSC timestamp.

      • getUserRawData

        public byte[] getUserRawData​()
        Obtains the user data excluding the data header.
        Returns:
        Returns the user data excluding the data header.

      • isReplaceMessage

        public boolean isReplaceMessage​()
        Checks whether the received SMS is a "replace short message". For details, see 3GPP TS 23.040 9.2.3.9.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the received SMS is a "replace short message"; returns false otherwise.

      • hasReplyPath

        public boolean hasReplyPath​()
        Checks whether the received SMS contains "TP-Reply-Path".
        Returns:
        Returns true if the received SMS contains "TP-Reply-Path"; returns false otherwise.
